snippet: Given his troubles with depression, addiction and a significant heart surgery in 2009, Mr. Williams should have had a résumé filled with mysterious gaps. Instead, he worked nonstop.
abstract: Robin Williams's suicide forever shut the window on a complicated soul that was rarely visible through the cracks of an astonishingly intact career; as Hollywood struggles to understand how Williams, effervescent in the extreme, could take his own life, authorities release details of his death; Williams, who had recently been treated for severe depression, hanged himself.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES
byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from San Rafael, Calif. Bill Carter and Benedict Carey contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Given his troubles with depression, addiction and a significant heart surgery in 2009, Mr. Williams should have had a résumé filled with mysterious gaps. Instead, he worked nonstop.

headline.main: Busy Working, Robin Williams Fought Demons
headline.print_headline: Busy Working, Robin Williams Fought Demons
